Option 1: Because this city was a key gateway for the conquest of Central Asia and served as a base for further Russian military operations.
Option 2: This city was the military center of the Kokand Khanate, and if it were captured, all the khanates would be militarily weakened.
Option 3: This city was located on the border of the Kokand Khanate and the Emirate of Bukhara, on the main road leading to the Khiva Khanate.
Option 4: This city was conveniently located on the water route to the Khiva Khanate.
Correct Answer: Because this city was a key gateway for the conquest of Central Asia and served as a base for further Russian military operations.
